page.title: 05CUSTOMS KIRKBY MALZEARD
page.content: Churches hold{Harvest Festivals}in Oct when fruit,flowers & vegetables are brought to special services. Harvest suppers follow & produce auctioned with proceeds going to a good cause. Also connected with the farming year are the{Plough Service}at K.Malzeard in Spring where the plough is brought into Church and blessed & the{Rogation {walk}at Grewelthorpe when churches unite & walk round the village singing & praying for Gods blessing on crops. {Guy Fawkes}night(Nov.5th)is celebrated by fireworks & a large bonfire in each village.Children here still go out on {Mischief Night}(Nov.4th)to play tricks on neighbours.(Yorks.custom) THE{Kirkby Malzeard sword dance}- now sadly extinct.Ancient & famous dance performed regularly in 19th C. But has declined & all revivals have failed. Music & Dance movements are documented
